unnormalised: A generous donation of ₹50,000 was made by Mr. Rakesh Kumar to the "Apna Ghar" orphanage on 15/08/2024, coinciding with Independence Day celebrations. This act of kindness aims to support the education and well-being of the children residing at the facility. Mr. Kumar, a local businessman, expressed his desire to give back to the community and contribute to a brighter future for these young individuals.
normalised: A generous donation of rupee fifty thousand was made by Mister Rakesh Kumar to the "Apna Ghar" orphanage on fifteenth august two thousand and twenty four, coinciding with Independence Day celebrations. This act of kindness aims to support the education and well-being of the children residing at the facility. Mister Kumar, a local businessman, expressed his desire to give back to the community and contribute to a brighter future for these young individuals.

unnormalised: Apna Ghar, located in Sector 10, Gurugram, has been providing shelter and care to orphaned and abandoned children for over 10 years. They rely heavily on donations from individuals and organizations to meet the daily needs of the children, including food, clothing, and educational resources. The donation from Mr. Kumar will be specifically allocated towards purchasing new textbooks and stationery for the upcoming academic year.

unnormalised: The orphanage's director, Mrs. Sunita Devi, expressed her gratitude for the generous contribution. She highlighted that such acts of charity have a significant impact on the lives of the children, providing them with hope and opportunities they wouldn't otherwise have. Mrs. Devi mentioned that the cost of running the orphanage is approx. ₹2 lakhs per month, relying on the kindness of donors.

unnormalised: Alongside the monetary donation, Mr. Kumar also pledged to provide regular mentorship and guidance to the children, offering them valuable life skills and career advice. This commitment goes beyond just financial aid; it is about investing in their future.
